page.title: 16 GHOSTS IN MY GARDEN
page.content: I live in a house on a hillside overlooking the sea.During the Occupation the property was used by the Germans.There are three gun emplacements in the grounds and the flat terrace which runs all the way across the gardens below the house, used to have a railway line on it which was used to ferry the ammunition to the bunkers.It is said that the dead and dying slave workers who built the bunkers were thrown into a dry well in the garden and it was then covered over with a very large granite stone.It was also said that the lonely spirits of these poor slaves were seen in the garden by a previous owner of the property. He told them that if they found comfort and rest there they were welcome to stay. BY{JEANETTE PIKE.
